page.title: 01The Lawley & Causeway Wood
page.content: The Lawley is covered in short grass and bracken and is used for sheep pasture. Lodge Hill and Hoar Edge are covered in a variety of conifers planted in the last 30 yrs. The lower land in the west is improved grassland mainly grazed by Friesian Dairy Cattle. There are also some large arable fields containing Wheat and Barley. patches of Deciduous woodland have been retained to provide cover for foxes. Some of the land between Hoar edge and the lawley is still unimproved and wilderness of boulders,bracken gorse, heather and sedge on which sheep and a few horses graze. Between Chatwell and Hoar edge much of the land has been improved to provide grassland for sheep and beef cattle. Most of the farmland is in good condition a sign of the prosperity of farming since the 50s.
